com.rexsl.page

Class CookieBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rexsl.page.CookieBuilder

  • @Loggable(value=1)
public final class CookieBuilder
extends Object
    Cookie builder.

    It is a convenient cookie builder for JAX-RS responses, for example: 

     Response.ok().cookie(
   new CookieBuilder(this.uriInfo().getBaseUri())
     .name("my-cookie")
     .value("some value of the cookie")
     .temporary()
     .build()
 );

    When you want to instruct the client to delete the cookie: 

     Response.ok().cookie(
   new CookieBuilder(this.uriInfo().getBaseUri())
     .name("my-cookie")
     .build()
 );

    It is much more convenient than new NewCookie(..) from JAX-RS.

    The class is mutable and thread-safe.

    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Yegor Bugayenko (yegor@tpc2.com)
    See Also:
    RFC6265
    To do:
    #381 Somehow we should specify PORT in the cookie. Without this param the site doesn't work in localhost:9099 in Chrome. Works fine in Safari, but not in Chrome. see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1612177
